Association: Genotype TT is associated with decreased overall survival when treated with nintedanib in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes GG + GT.
More Details: since there was no difference in OS between genotypes in the pirfenidone group, patients with TT genotype of rs2076295 had signiifcantly better OS with pirfenidone than with nintedanib treatment.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to acetylcysteine in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes GG + GT.
More Details: Clinical endpoints included death, transplant, hospitalization, or FVC decline,  and risk was adjusted for age, sex, prednisone use, azathioprine use, FVC, diffusion capacity of the lung, and trial/center. Alleles given on reverse strand A and G.

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to acetylcysteine in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Clinical endpoints included death, transplant, hospitalization, or FVC decline,  and risk was adjusted for age, sex, prednisone use, azathioprine use, FVC, diffusion capacity of the lung, and trial/center. Alleles given on reverse strand A and G.

Association: Genotypes CC + CT is associated with increased overall survival when treated with pirfenidone in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotype TT.
Biogeographical Groups: Multiple groups, "Most of the study population were Caucasians (52 subjects, 94.54%)."
More Details: "The TOLLIP rs5743890 risk allele was significantly associated with improved survival, with increasing pirfenidone duration, for CC or CT genotype carriers but not for those with the TT genotype"

Association: Genotype TT is not associated with response to acetylcysteine in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Clinical endpoints included death, transplant, hospitalization, or FVC decline,  and risk was adjusted for age, sex, prednisone use, azathioprine use, FVC, diffusion capacity of the lung, and trial/center. Alleles given on reverse strand A and G.

Association: Genotype CC is not associated with response to acetylcysteine in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes CG + GG.
More Details: Clinical endpoints included death, transplant, hospitalization, or FVC decline,  and risk was adjusted for age, sex, prednisone use, azathioprine use, FVC, diffusion capacity of the lung, and trial/center. Alleles given on reverse strand A and G.

Association: Genotype AA is associated with decreased likelihood of adverse events when treated with pirfenidone in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes AC + CC.
More Details: " In the AA group, the ADR incidence was notably lower than that in the C allele carriers (CC+AC) (28.0% vs. 63.2%, P = 0.020; Table 3).""Nineteen individuals experienced 24 ADRs, which were mostly mild-to-moderate and tolerable. Gastrointestinal ADRs were the most frequent"

Association: Genotype TT is associated with increased response to acetylcysteine in people with Pulmonary Fibrosis as compared to genotypes CC + CT.
More Details: Clinical endpoints included death, transplant, hospitalization, or FVC decline,  and risk was adjusted for age, sex, prednisone use, azathioprine use, FVC, diffusion capacity of the lung, and trial/center.
